casebody.data:
JOHN HOGAN, Plaintiff and Appellant, v. WILLIAM E. LAIMBEER, Defendant and Respondent.

Before Monell, Ch. J., Curtis and Speir, JJ.

The only point involved in the appeal was whether the verdict was correct on the evidence. The court held it was, and affirmed the judgment. Heard April, 1875; Decided May 3, 1875. Speir, J.,

wrote for affirmance.

Monell, Ch. J., and Curtis, J., concurred.
